molecular.statistics.time_series.acov¶

molecular.statistics.time_series.acov(a, fft=False)[source]¶

Compute the unbiased auto-covariance function \(\gamma(k)\) from dataset \(a\) with \(N\) samples for lag-time \(k\).

\[\gamma(k)=\frac{1}{N-k}\sum_{t=1}^{N-k}(a_t - \mu)(a_{t+k} - \mu)\]

Here, we also compute the mean

\[\mu=\frac{1}{N}\sum_t^Na_t\]

Note: by default, all \(k\) from 0 to N-1 are evaluated. Sampling deteriorates rapidly as \(k\) increases. There is also a biased estimator for the autocovariance, which changes the denominator from \(n-k\) to \(n\) and has an effect of reducing the fluctuations due to error at large \(k\). To compute this, see statsmodels.tsa.stattools.acovf().

Parameters

  • a (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array.

  • fft (bool) – Should Fast-Fourier Transform be used?

Returns

Autocovariance function

Return type

numpy.ndarray

References

https://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/handbook/eda/section3/autocopl.htm
